intro: Hyoseris monspeliensis, commonly known as the mountain hyoseris, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, arid environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in summer, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Hyoseris monspeliensis is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
